textTemplates.name: EmailMsgCSaleReminderNtfyParticipants
textTemplates.text:
Victorian Homebuyer Fund

Property sale request approved - signed Contract of Sale reminder

Dear {!$Record.Account.FirstName}

We've approved your request to sell the property {!$Record.Property_Address__c}. This is a reminder to login to the portal to upload the signed Contract of Sale as soon as possible. Failure to do so could result in the settlement being delayed.
 

Request details
 
Request ID {!$Record.CaseNumber}
Status {!$Record.Status}
Submitted on {!SubmitDate}
Submitted By {!$Record.Account.FirstName} {!$Record.Account.LastName}

 Log in 
sro.vic.gov.au      Phone (03) 7020 1549

© State of Victoria (State Revenue Office)
GPO Box 1641 Melbourne Victoria 3001  Australia

textTemplates.name: EmailMsgCSaleUploadedParticipants
textTemplates.text:
Victorian Homebuyer Fund

Contract of Sale uploaded

Dear {!$Record.Account.FirstName}

We have received the signed Contract of Sale for the Sale for the property {!$Record.Property_Address__c}. A valuation will be conducted by the Valuer-General Victoria if a valid one does not exist, the higher of the valuation or sale price will then be used to calculate the final payment amount.
 

Request details
 
Request ID {!$Record.CaseNumber}
Status {!$Record.Status}
Submitted on {!SubmitDate}
Submitted By {!$Record.Account.FirstName} {!$Record.Account.LastName}

   View request      


What's next?

An SRO officer will process the case and you will receive a notification about how the proceeds of the sale will be distributed at settlement.

Any queries, please contact us.

sro.vic.gov.au      Phone (03) 7020 1549

© State of Victoria (State Revenue Office)
GPO Box 1641 Melbourne Victoria 3001  Australia

textTemplates.name: EmailMsgCSaleUploadNtfySROofficer
textTemplates.text:
Victorian Homebuyer Fund

Contract of Sale uploaded

Dear SRO officer

The participant has uploaded a signed Contract of Sale for the sale of the property{!$Record.Property_Address__c}.

Please process the request further.
 

Request details
 
Request ID {!$Record.CaseNumber}
Status {!$Record.Status}
Submitted on {!SubmitDate}
Submitted By {!$Record.Account.FirstName} {!$Record.Account.LastName}

   View request
sro.vic.gov.au      Phone (03) 7020 1549

© State of Victoria (State Revenue Office)
GPO Box 1641 Melbourne Victoria 3001  Australia

textTemplates.description: Notification to VGO to discharge mortgage
textTemplates.name: EmailMsgFinalPaymentProcessedVGSO
textTemplates.text:
Victorian Homebuyer Fund

Payment processed

Dear VGSO

A final payment made against the property {!$Record.Property_Address__c} has been processed.

Please discharge the mortgage and login to VGSO portal and update the status for the request to mortgage discharged.
 

Request Details
 
Request ID {!$Record.CaseNumber}
Status {!$Record.Status}

   View Request      
sro.vic.gov.au      Phone (03) 7020 1549

© State of Victoria (State Revenue Office)
GPO Box 1641 Melbourne Victoria 3001  Australia

textTemplates.name: EmailMsgFinalPaymentSubmittedParticipants
textTemplates.text:
Victorian Homebuyer Fund
Final payment request submitted

Dear {!$Record.Account.FirstName}

We have received your final payment request.
 

Request details
 
Request ID {!$Record.CaseNumber}
Submitted on {!SubmitDate}
Submitted By {!$Record.Account.FirstName} {!$Record.Account.LastName}

   View request      
 

What's next?

We will review your request and notify you of the outcome. If approved, a valuation may need to be carried out on your property to determine the final payment amount.
 
sro.vic.gov.au      Phone (03) 7020 1549

© State of Victoria (State Revenue Office)
GPO Box 1641 Melbourne Victoria 3001  Australia

textTemplates.name: EmailMsgFinalPymntRejected

Victorian Homebuyer Fund

© State of Victoria (State Revenue Office)
GPO Box 1641 Melbourne Victoria 3001  Australia

textTemplates.name: EmailMsgITEApprovedSRO
textTemplates.text:
Victorian Homebuyer Fund

Loan increase approved

Dear SRO officer

The income threshold case which was pending with participant to apply for loan increase and notify SRO of the outcome, has been approved now. Please review the income threshold exceeded case and process it further.
 

Request Details
 
Request ID {!$Record.CaseNumber}
Property ID {!$Record.Property__r.OrderNumber}

   View Request      
sro.vic.gov.au      Phone (03) 7020 1549

© State of Victoria (State Revenue Office)
GPO Box 1641 Melbourne Victoria 3001  Australia

textTemplates.name: EmailMsgITECancelledParticipants
textTemplates.text:
Victorian Homebuyer Fund

Income threshold exceeded - case cancelled

Dear {!$Record.Account.FirstName}

The income threshold exceeded case that was raised because the income details submitted in annual review {!$Record.Annual_Review_Period__c} exceeded the applicable threshold in two consecutive periods, is now cancelled. The reasons why are detailed below.
 

Request details
 
Request ID {!$Record.CaseNumber}
Cancellation reason {!$Record.Cancellation_Reason__c}
Cancellation Comments {!$Record.Cancellation_Reason_Comments__c}

   View request      
sro.vic.gov.au      Phone (03) 7020 1549

© State of Victoria (State Revenue Office)
GPO Box 1641 Melbourne Victoria 3001  Australia

textTemplates.name: EmailMsgITERejectedSRO
textTemplates.text:
Victorian Homebuyer Fund
Loan increase rejected

Dear SRO officer

The income threshold case which was pending, with the participant to apply for a loan increase and notify SRO of the outcome, has been rejected . Please review the income threshold exceeded case and process it further.
 

Request Details
 
Request ID {!$Record.CaseNumber}
Property ID {!$Record.Property__r.OrderNumber}

   View request      
sro.vic.gov.au      Phone (03) 7020 1549

© State of Victoria (State Revenue Office)
GPO Box 1641 Melbourne Victoria 3001  Australia

textTemplates.name: EmailMsgITEReqPanelFinancier
textTemplates.text:
Victorian Homebuyer Fund

Income threshold exceeded

Dear Panel Financier

This is to inform you that for the property {!$Record.Property_Address__c}, the participant's income has exceeded the threshold allowed in the Participation Agreement. As a result, they are requested to apply to refinance their home loan to pay down some of the State's equity.

Please note they are required to apply to refinance their loan by the maximum amount permitted by yourselves, within a range provided to them. The minimum of the range will be an amount needed to reduce the State's equity in their property by 5%. The maximum is the amount required to exit the VHF.

Once you have the information for refinance, please raise a refinance case against the property. If a refinance case has already been raised, please disregard this request.
  

sro.vic.gov.au      Phone (03) 7020 1549

© State of Victoria (State Revenue Office)
GPO Box 1641 Melbourne Victoria 3001  Australia

textTemplates.name: EmailMsgITEReqReminderParticipants
textTemplates.text:
Victorian Homebuyer Fund

Reminder: Income threshold exceeded

Dear {!$Record.Account.FirstName}

This is a reminder that your income details submitted as part of the annual review {!$Record.Annual_Review__r.Annual_review_period__c} have been reviewed and the applicable gross income has exceeded the income threshold on two consecutive reporting dates.

Under the terms of the Participation Agreement, you are required to apply for refinancing and increase the loan by the maximum amount permitted by the panel financier within the range provided below and notify the SRO of the outcome. Failure to do so will lead to an early payment request, which means you will have to exit the scheme.

The Minimum Loan Increase Amount is the amount you must pay to reduce the State's equity in your property by 5%.

The Exit Payment is the amount required to reduce the state's equity in your property to 0%, which would result in an exit from the VHF.
 

Request details
 
Request ID {!$Record.CaseNumber}
Submitted on {!SubmitDate}
Minimum Loan Increase Amount ${!$Record.Minimum_Loan_Increase_Amount__c}
Exit Payment $ {!$Record.Exit_Payment__c}

   View request      


What's next?

Apply to refinance your loan with a participating lender and notify the SRO of the outcome by logging into the participant portal. You will be requested to make a payment when the loan request is approved.

sro.vic.gov.au      Phone (03) 7020 1549

© State of Victoria (State Revenue Office)
GPO Box 1641 Melbourne Victoria 3001  Australia

textTemplates.name: EmailMsgITERequestedParticipants
textTemplates.text:
Victorian Homebuyer Fund

Income threshold exceeded

Dear {!$Record.Account.FirstName}

Your income details submitted as part of the annual review {!$Record.Annual_Review__r.Annual_review_period__c} have been reviewed and the applicable gross income has exceeded the income threshold on two consecutive reporting dates.

Under the terms of the Participation Agreement, you are now required to apply for refinancing and increase the loan by the maximum amount permitted by the panel financier within the range for loan increase provided below and notify SRO of the outcome within 90 days.

The Minimum Loan Increase Amount is the amount you must pay to reduce the State's equity in your property by 5%.

The Exit Payment is the amount required to reduce the state's equity in your property to 0%, which would result in an exit from the VHF.
 

Request details
 
Request ID {!$Record.CaseNumber}
Submitted on {!SubmitDate}
Minimum Loan Increase Amount ${!$Record.Minimum_Loan_Increase_Amount__c}
Exit Payment ${!$Record.Exit_Payment__c}


What's next?

Apply to refinance your loan with a participating lender and notify the SRO of the outcome by logging into the participant portal. A payment request will be generated when the loan refinance request is approved.

   Log in      
sro.vic.gov.au      Phone (03) 7020 1549

© State of Victoria (State Revenue Office)
GPO Box 1641 Melbourne Victoria 3001  Australia

textTemplates.name: EmailMsgLTAApprovedAnnualReview
textTemplates.text:
Victorian Homebuyer Fund
Long Term Absence recorded

Dear {!PrimaryParticipantFirstname}

We have approved and recorded your Long Term Absence details within your annual review {!$Record.Annual_Review__r.Name} for the property {!$Record.Property_Address__c}.
The reason you provided for the absence was {!$Record.Absence_reason__c}.

As a result of this, total absence recorded till now on the property is {!$Record.Property__r.Absence_duration_total__c} months.

 

Request Details
 
Request ID {!$Record.CaseNumber}
Absence Start date {!AbsenceStartDate}
Absence End date {!AbsenceEndDate}
Approved on {!ApprovedDate}
Absence duration in current annual review {!$Record.Valid_Absence_Duration_Months__c} Months


In case the long term absence was overlapping for more than one annual review period, the approval is only granted for the absence duration in the current annual review period.

For subsequent periods, you need to report the absence again in the next annual review, which would be verified at that time.
 
sro.vic.gov.au      Phone (03) 7020 1549

© State of Victoria (State Revenue Office)
GPO Box 1641 Melbourne Victoria 3001  Australia

textTemplates.name: EmailMsgLTAApprovedParticipants
textTemplates.text:
Victorian Homebuyer Fund
Long Term Absence request approved

Dear {!PrimaryParticipantFirstname}

Your request has been approved for Long Term Absence for the property {!$Record.Property_Address__c}.

You may proceed with the absence by adhering to the details submitted with your approved request.
 

Long Term Absence Request Details
 
Request ID {!$Record.CaseNumber}
Absence Start date {!AbsenceStartDate}
Absence End date {!AbsenceEndDate}
Submitted on {!SubmitDate}
Submitted By {!$Record.Account.FirstName} {!$Record.Account.LastName}
Approved on {!ApprovedDate}
View Request   
sro.vic.gov.au      Phone 13 21 61
© State of Victoria (State Revenue Office)
       GPO Box 1641 Melbourne Victoria 3001  Australia

textTemplates.name: EmailMsgLTACancelledAnnualReview
textTemplates.text:
Victorian Homebuyer Fund
Long Term Absence cancelled

Dear {!PrimaryParticipantFirstname}

Your Long term absence request within your annual review {!$Record.Annual_Review__r.Name} for the property {!$Record.Property_Address__c} has been cancelled.


Request Details
 
Request ID {!$Record.CaseNumber}
Absence Start date {!AbsenceStartDate}
Absence End date {!AbsenceEndDate}
Cancellation Reason {!$Record.Rejection_Reason__c}
Cancellation Comments {!$Record.Rejection_Reason_Comments__c}
Absence duration in current annual review {!$Record.Valid_Absence_Duration_Months__c} Months


In case the long term absence was overlapping for more than one annual review period, this cancellation is only for the absence duration in the current annual review period.

For subsequent periods, you need to report the absence again in the next annual review, which would be verified at that time.
 
sro.vic.gov.au      Phone (03) 7020 1549

© State of Victoria (State Revenue Office)
GPO Box 1641 Melbourne Victoria 3001  Australia

Your Long Term Absence request within your annual review {!$Record.Annual_Review__r.Name} for the property {!$Record.Property_Address__c} has been declined.

As a result of this, total absence recorded till now on the property is {!$Record.Property__r.Absence_duration_total__c} months.

Absence Start date {!AbsenceStartDate}
Absence End date {!AbsenceEndDate}
Declined Reason {!$Record.Rejection_Reason__c}
Declined Comments {!$Record.Rejection_Reason_Comments__c}

In case the Long Term Absence was overlapping for more than one annual review period, please note this denial is only for this absence duration in the current annual review period.

For subsequent periods, you need to report the absence again in the next annual review, which would be verified at that time.
 
sro.vic.gov.au      Phone (03) 7020 1549

© State of Victoria (State Revenue Office)
GPO Box 1641 Melbourne Victoria 3001  Australia

textTemplates.name: EmailMsgPSaleApprovedParticipants
textTemplates.text:
Victorian Homebuyer Fund

Property sale request approved

Dear {!$Record.Account.FirstName}

We've approved your request to sell the property {!$Record.Property_Address__c}. You must upload a signed Contract of Sale as soon as you have one. Please note that a valuation will be conducted by the Valuer-General Victoria if a valid one does not exist. The higher of the valuation or sale price will be used to calculate the final payment amount to exit the VHF.
 

Request details
 
Request ID {!$Record.CaseNumber}
Status {!$Record.Status}
Submitted on {!SubmitDate}
Submitted By {!$Record.Account.FirstName} {!$Record.Account.LastName}


What's next?

Once you have a signed Contract of Sale, please logon to the portal and upload it as soon as possible to avoid any delay in settlement.

   Log in   

sro.vic.gov.au      Phone (03) 7020 1549

© State of Victoria (State Revenue Office)
GPO Box 1641 Melbourne Victoria 3001  Australia

textTemplates.name: EmailMsgPSaleParticipants
textTemplates.text:
Victorian Homebuyer Fund

Property sale request received

Dear {!$Record.Account.FirstName}

We've received your request to sell the property {!$Record.Property_Address__c}. If your request is approved, a valuation will be conducted by the Valuer-General Victoria if a valid one does not exist. The higher of the valuation or Contact of Sale price will be used to calculate the final payment amount to exit the VHF.
 

Request details
 
Request ID {!$Record.CaseNumber}
Submitted on {!SubmitDate}
Submitted By {!$Record.Account.FirstName} {!$Record.Account.LastName}

   View request      


What's next?

We will review your request and notify you of the outcome.

sro.vic.gov.au      Phone (03) 7020 1549

© State of Victoria (State Revenue Office)
GPO Box 1641 Melbourne Victoria 3001  Australia

textTemplates.name: EmailMsgRefinanceRemediationRequiredParticipants
textTemplates.text:
Victorian Homebuyer Fund
Refinance remediation required

Dear {!$Record.Account.FirstName}

We have received a refinance request submitted by {!$Record.Current_Panel_Financier__r.Name} indicating that the home loan for {!$Record.Property_Address__c} is being refinanced with {!$Record.Refinancing_bank__c}.
 
As per the Participation Agreement, the home loan for a VHF property must be with an approved Panel Financier. If you want to continue with this refinance, you will be requested to make an early payment and exit from the scheme.
 
If you want to continue to be part of the scheme, then please contact the SRO on 03 7020 1549 to cancel the current refinance request and take the necessary steps to apply for refinancing with an approved Panel Financier.
 

Request details
 
Request ID {!$Record.CaseNumber}
Submitted on {!SubmitDate}
Submitted By {!$Record.Contact_Full_Name__c}

   View request      
sro.vic.gov.au      Phone (03) 7020 1549

© State of Victoria (State Revenue Office)
GPO Box 1641 Melbourne Victoria 3001  Australia
